Now, it is a part of the [[Vasai-Virar]] city. The Portuguese built a fort in Vasai, which strengthened their naval superiority over the Arabian Sea. In the 18th century, the fort was taken over by the Maratha army under Peshwa Baji Rao's brother Chimaji Appa, and fell in 1739 after a [[Battle of Vasai|three-year-long campaign]]. The British then took over the territory from the Marathas.
